definition[0]: to be wearing a piece of clothing or type of clothing
example[0]: He had his best suit on.
example[1]: Jimmy had nothing on but his socks.
definition[1]: if you have your television, radio etc on, you have switched it on and it is working
example[2]: Billie has the radio on all day long.
definition[2]: to be trying to make someone believe something that is not true, especially as a joke
example[3]: Don’t believe a word he says. He’s having you on!
definition[3]: to have arranged to do something, go somewhere etc, especially when this means you cannot do something else
example[4]: Sorry, I can’t help you this weekend – I’ve got too much on already.
definition[4]: to know about something bad that someone has done
example[5]: What do the police have on him?
definition[5]: to not be nearly as good as someone or something else
example[6]: Rock ‘n’ roll has got nothing on these African rhythms.
